alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Clarke; Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 10:36PM CDT until March 30 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Monroe County in south central Alabama... Northwestern Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama... Southeastern Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Southeastern Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... Northwestern Escambia County in south central Alabama... Southern Wilcox County in south central Alabama... Central Conecuh County in south central Alabama... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 1036 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Yellow Bluff to 11 miles southeast of Whatley to 3 miles west of Calvert, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Frisco City, McCullough, Peterman, Uriah, Calvert, Excel, Beatrice, Vredenburgh, Repton, Pine Apple, I65 And US 84, I65 And AL 113, I65 And AL 21 and Poarch Creek Reservation. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin; Clarke; Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox
